overview_of_class: Chinese Foreign Policy This course discusses the basic dynamics of Chinese foreign policy since the Nineteenth Century, with principal focus on the period since 1949 (and especially since 19880). Policy toward a variety of countries and regions and on a variety of issues (e.g. security, trade, development, etc.) will be covered, with some special emphasis on China's relations with the United States. Finally, we will examine China's foreign policy in comparison with that of other countries and explore implication for wider literatures and theories in IR and comparative politics.
name: Chinese Foreign Policy
subject: POLI_SCI
